body: thanks - one thing you might wanna double check though, is the integration of this extended converter. Right now there is not a single invocation with a schema other than DF schemas (which was the functionality provided before).

Hi @gweidner. If I run a "hello world", I see console output like the following:
`ANTLR Tool version 4.3 used for code generation does not match the current runtime version 4.5.3ANTLR Tool version 4.3 used for code generation does not match the current runtime version 4.5.3hello world`
Is that the expected output? It's possible I may have done something wrong though.

WRT those messages I see, when I do a 'mvn clean package -P distribution', I see the following:

```
...
[INFO] --- antlr4-maven-plugin:4.5.3:antlr4 (antlr) @ systemml ---
[INFO] No grammars to process
[INFO] ANTLR 4: Processing source directory /Users/deroneriksson/Documents/workspace2/incubator-systemml/src/main/java
...
```

So does that mean that the Java files aren't being properly generated by the maven plugin since it says "No grammars to process"?

Hi @deroneriksson,
Thanks for reviewing and testing.  The 'No grammars to process' occurs since the src/main/java/*.tokens files don't get deleted when doing a mvn clean.  You need to manually delete them before doing your distribution build.  This is also why I didn't catch the initial issue when switching between 4.5.3 in my development environment as compared to build machine which starts with clean workspace.  So manually delete the 4 .tokens files to get them processed under new antlr.

Also - for the previous question regarding the ANTRL mismatch warning.  That's exactly the message that this patch fixes.  I was able to test the first cases described at http://apache.github.io/incubator-systemml/release-process.html using artifacts from https://sparktc.ibmcloud.com/jenkins/job/SystemML-PullRequestBuilder/679/org.apache.systemml$systemml/ and do not see that message.

Great! I will try this out very soon! Perhaps in a separate PR we can work deleting those files into the build. Otherwise people may see the same warnings I saw and get confused.

Great job Glenn! Removing the tokens files took care of that message during the build and took care of the ANTLR warning messages for me.

LGTM.

As a couple followups:
1) Perhaps we could create a JIRA to delete the tokens files and regenerate new ones during the build (and handle this as a separate PR).
2) I believe the previous antlr transitive dependency org.abego.treelayout.core may no longer be needed. I saw a couple warnings about "The following patterns were never triggered in this artifact exclusion filter: '_:org.abego.treelayout.core_'" for the standalone.xml assembly. So we probably need to remove this from the assembly and the LICENSE files if this is indeed the case. This would be good as a separate JIRA/PR if this is true.
(BTW I can look into this too if you are busy. I'm doing some updates to the build so I happen to be doing maven stuff right now.)
Thank you @deroneriksson for review!  Yes - I also encountered the org.abego.treelayout exclusion warning so thanks in advance for cleaning that up in separate jiras/pr.
LGTM - thanks @asurve
LGTM

@mboehm7 Please feel free to make any updates to the pom that you wish.

Thank you Deron for handling this.  I verified from command line that mvn build was successful and the tokens files regenerated.  There's one error I hit in my Eclipse IDE at the line corresponding to remove-antlr-tokens-files execution :
Plugin execution not covered by lifecycle configuration: org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-clean-plugin:3.0.0:clean (execution: remove-antlr-tokens-files, phase: initialize)
Did you encounter in your dev IDE?  It might be that I need to enable/install/upgrade more m2e into my Eclipse.

Thank you for looking at this @gweidner. I don't get that Eclipse warning in my Eclipse. We might need to add an entry in the pom.xml for the m2e lifecycle-mapping plugin to make that warning go away for you. 

Could you add the following `<pluginExecution>` to the lifecycle-mapping and let me know if the warning goes away?

```
<pluginExecution>
    <pluginExecutionFilter>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-clean-plugin</artifactId>
        <versionRange>[3.0.0,)</versionRange>
        <goals>
            <goal>initialize</goal>
        </goals>
    </pluginExecutionFilter>
    <action>
        <ignore>
        </ignore>
    </action>
</pluginExecution>
```
cc @gweidner
Tests running here: https://sparktc.ibmcloud.com/jenkins/job/SystemML-PullRequestBuilder/687/

Great fix @deroneriksson - that worked with clean instead of initialize for goal. Test passed plus no IDE issue after including fragment with 'clean' goal you provided. Once that additional change included in POM ready to merge. LGTM

Great! I'll update the `<pluginExecution>` to

```
<pluginExecution>
    <pluginExecutionFilter>
        <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
        <artifactId>maven-clean-plugin</artifactId>
        <versionRange>[3.0.0,)</versionRange>
        <goals>
            <goal>clean</goal>
        </goals>
    </pluginExecutionFilter>
    <action>
        <ignore>
        </ignore>
    </action>
</pluginExecution>
```

Thank you for reviewing!

Thanks Sandeep for fixing the range-related bug in this PR. The fix itself looks good to me. For consistency, I would recommend keeping the logic of `RangeTest`  similar to  https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/blob/master/src/test/java/org/apache/sysml/test/integration/functions/data/SequenceTest.java and parameterizing Range1.pydml and Range2.pydml (similar to Sequence.dml and Sequence2inputs.dml), i.e.:

``` bash
# license ...
A = range($1, $2, $3);
save(A, $4);
```

The code of RangeTest would then be similar to SequenceTest except following changes to :
1. Test-case naming: https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/blob/master/src/test/java/org/apache/sysml/test/integration/functions/data/SequenceTest.java#L47
2. Invoking the .pydml https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/blob/master/src/test/java/org/apache/sysml/test/integration/functions/data/SequenceTest.java#L108

This way, you check with R for sanity testing rather than constant data. Also, other developers are free to try testing range with different parameters: https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/blob/master/src/test/java/org/apache/sysml/test/integration/functions/data/SequenceTest.java#L69 

Alternatively, you can extend `SequenceTest` itself by adding an additional parameter isPyDML at https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/blob/master/src/test/java/org/apache/sysml/test/integration/functions/data/SequenceTest.java#L69 and to the constructor https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/blob/master/src/test/java/org/apache/sysml/test/integration/functions/data/SequenceTest.java#L57. Then depending of whether isPyDML is true or not, you can chose appropriate file to execute, i.e. https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/blob/master/src/test/java/org/apache/sysml/test/integration/functions/data/SequenceTest.java#L108.

For other committers, I have sanity tested this PR with following code and it works as expected:

``` bash
X = range(5, 2) # range(5, 2, -2), range(1, 5), ... works as expected
# Also, range(5,1,1) throws LanguageException
str = toString(X)
print(str)
```

that's a great catch. It used to work with our old javacc parser. Seeing it show up now means there is not a single related testcase in our testsuite yet. Could you please extend ForLoopPredicateTest in test.integration.functions.parfor by one or two tests for this pattern? Thanks.
LGTM - thanks @asurve
thanks

The abego license text was restored from previous version and the stringtemplate license text based on http://www.stringtemplate.org/license.html which matches the ANTRL license at http://www.antlr.org/license.html except for names listed after copyright year.

LGTM. Thanks @sandeep-n :)

Great catch @gweidner! Looks like for the ANTLR 4.5.3 that rather than using transitive dependencies, they actually pack org.abego.\* and org.stringtemplate.\* into the actual antlr4-4.5.3.jar file. So you are correct that these need to be added to the license for the standalone jar.

LGTM.

I think this will also need to be added to some of our other artifacts (the license for antlr which I recently removed and the additional license for stringtemplate). I will investigate and go ahead and do this.
Thanks for reviewing @niketanpansare - I will merge.
@mboehm7  Done.

Thanks for the review @deroneriksson! Before updating licenses (including the one in this PR), let me check if the ANTRL4 Tool jar can be removed from pom for standalone which would help reduce license dependencies.
I would be surprised if it can be removed, but definitely check.
cc @gweidner
Actually, I see lots of "import org.antlr.v4.runtime.*" imports in the project, so that might actually work (since the runtime is a separate dependency).
I will also need to check for https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/pull/263. Please let me know how your test goes.

As an alternative approach, I changed the standalone-jar.xml such that the ANTLR Tool jar (antlr4-4.5.3.jar) classes were no longer bundled.  Extracting the contents of the resulting standalone-jar no longer included org.abego or org.stringtemplate classes.  So I also removed the StringTemplate license, abego TreeLayout license, and reference to ANTLR 4 Tool from standalone-jar's license text.

Hi Deron - thanks for handling this artifact.  Could you try changing the standalone.xml so only antlr4-runtime included and ANTLR4 Tool jar (antlr4-4.5.3.jar) doesn't get pulled-in?
@gweidner I also investigated this and saw similar results (that we can remove the antlr tool jar). I will also update my JIRA/PR for the standalone tar.gz and zip, which have a similar situation.

After an examination, it appears that the antlr4-4.5.3.jar (tool jar) is not needed for the standalone tar.gz and zip artifacts. Therefore, I will close this JIRA/PR and create a new JIRA/PR to remove the antlr4 tool jar from the standalone tar.gz and zip artifacts.
Thank you for looking at this too @gweidner. I investigated and came to the same conclusion.

This is the same issue addressed by https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/pull/261 but for the standalone tar.gz and zip artifacts.

@gweidner Please review.

Here are a couple basic checks I did (univar stats and hello world):

```
wget -P data/ http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/haberman/haberman.data
echo '{"rows": 306, "cols": 4, "format": "csv"}' > data/haberman.data.mtd
echo '1,1,1,2' > data/types.csv
echo '{"rows": 1, "cols": 4, "format": "csv"}' > data/types.csv.mtd
cd target
tar -xvzf systemml-0.12.0-incubating-SNAPSHOT-standalone.tar.gz
cd systemml-0.12.0-incubating-SNAPSHOT-standalone
./runStandaloneSystemML.sh ../../scripts/algorithms/Univar-Stats.dml -nvargs X=../../data/haberman.data TYPES=../../data/types.csv STATS=../../data/univarOut.mtx CONSOLE_OUTPUT=TRUE
echo "print('hello world');" > hello.dml
./runStandaloneSystemML.sh hello.dml
```

Assuming the tests pass, LGTM.

The contents of the the standalone jar look good (the only antlr classes I see are the runtime classes). The LICENSE also has been updated to not include the antlr tool library. I also tested the standalone jar with a 'hello world' example and a univariate stats example and both worked successfully.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12634533/18977793/4f75f7a8-8672-11e6-85ed-333859a629eb.png)

After talking with @niketanpansare and looking at the documentation for the [javadoc](https://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-javadoc-plugin/examples/javadoc-resources.html) phase, I think the file `overview.html` should be in `src/main/javadoc/overview.html` and not where its currently put.
@MadisonJMyers, @deroneriksson - do you think this content would be useful to have in the github wiki and link to it in the `README.md` ?

and @niketanpansare - thank you!
this is very good work and a much needed effort in the direction of documentation that helps newcomer.
@nakul02 When we have the javadocs deployed on the main website, this documentation will appear when a user goes to the javadocs, so I believe I would use this path to get to the overview.
@deroneriksson @nakul02 I will move the overview.html to the directory that nakul recommended in my next commit :) ... Is there an umbrella JIRA for improving the documentation ?
@niketanpansare there are probably 200 things needed for improving the documentation, so i'm not sure if a single umbrella JIRA handles it all.
I understand. It just feels little awkward to push a PR without JIRA associated with it :(
Please feel free to create a JIRA for it. I would definitely create a JIRA if I were you. With component set to Documentation.

@niketanpansare Before merging please also verify that the overview renders correctly when 'mvn javadoc:javadoc ...' is run and also when 'mvn clean package -P distribution' generates the javadoc jar.
Both  'mvn javadoc:javadoc ...' and 'mvn clean package -P distribution' are tested and works correctly on my setup after recent commit.

@niketanpansare Great! I verified that both commands work correctly for me too with Java 8.

LGTM.

To compile Python doc, you need to install Sphinx

``` bash
pip install -U Sphinx
```

Then prepare docs:

``` bash
cd src/main/python
sphinx-apidoc --full --force --output-dir docs systemml
```

Add following lines to src/main/python/docs/conf.py

``` python
import sys
sys.path.append('/home/biuser/nike/python/apache/incubator-systemml/src/main/python')
autodoc_mock_imports = ['pyspark', 'py4j.java_gateway', 'pyspark.mllib.common', 'pyspark.context', 'pyspark.sql', 'pyspark.ml', 'pyspark.ml.feature']
```

Make the doc

``` bash
cd docs
make singlehtml
or 
make html
```

Here is a sample document generated by above steps:
[python_systemml_documentation.pdf](https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml/files/503900/python_systemml_documentation.pdf)

This will enable both classes to be included in test harness run which should result in 12 more tests.  After the release, I can check changing the pom to select the tests instead of package suite.
